    • Field Detail

      • cyclesPerFrame

        public final MutableInteger cyclesPerFrame

      • perfection

        @NotNull
public org.apache.commons.lang3.mutable.MutableFloat perfection
        Perfection determines a minimum budget prioritization of items in proportion to the budgeted quality. This means that the attention of a reasoner in higher perfection state will be more dominated by high-quality items. In other words, it is driven more towards maximization of quality rather than allowing for exploration of that which has less quality. previously called "bag threshold" and had default value = 0.1

      • duration

        public final MutableInteger duration
        Cycles per duration. Past/future tense usage convention; How far away "past" and "future" is from "now", in cycles. The range of "now" is [-DURATION/2, +DURATION/2];

      • shortTermMemoryHistory

        public final MutableInteger shortTermMemoryHistory

      • linkForgetDurations

        public final org.apache.commons.lang3.mutable.MutableFloat linkForgetDurations
        TaskLink decay rate in TaskLinkBag, in [1, 99]. originally: TASK_LINK_FORGETTING_CYCLE

      • conceptForgetDurations

        public final org.apache.commons.lang3.mutable.MutableFloat taskProcessThreshold
        budget summary necessary to run a TaskProcess for a given Task this should be equal to zero to allow subconcept seeding.
